H0.text: Trumpets and trombones are most commonly pitched at. EE

H1.text: Trumpets and trombones are most commonly pitched at. CC

H2.text: Trumpets and trombones are most commonly pitched at. FF

H3.text: Trumpets and trombones are most commonly pitched at. BB

A4.text: The most common type is the B♭ trumpet, but A, C, D, E♭, E, low F, and G trumpets are also available.

A5.text: The C trumpet is most common in American orchestral playing, where it is used alongside the B♭ trumpet.

A6.text: The tenor trombone has a fundamental note of B♭ and is usually treated as a non-transposing instrument.

A7.text: The once common E♭ alto trombone became less common as improvements in technique extended the upper range of the tenor, but it is regaining popularity for its lighter sonority.
